text:
:rotating_light: *URGENT HELP NEEDED!* :rotating_light:

Hey everyone,

I have a global partial that contains a header navigation module built in *React & TypeScript*. A few months ago, I replaced the old header module across all templates with this new navigation in our *new theme*.

Suddenly, the new header has stopped working *on some pages (without throwing any error)* of the website.

:white_check_mark: *Works on:*
• Homepage: <https://www.bannerflow.com/>
:x: *Doesn’t work on:*
• Blog Post: <https://www.bannerflow.com/blog/the-beginners-guide-to-personalization-at-scale>
• Blog Overview: <https://www.bannerflow.com/blog>
• <https://www.bannerflow.com/solution/case/scoot>
What’s strange is that this issue appears *randomly*—sometimes it works, sometimes it doesn’t. Also, when previewing the pages where the header *doesn’t work*, it *shows up fine in Preview Mode and hsDebug Mode*.

Has anyone encountered a similar issue before? Any insights would be greatly appreciated! :rocket: <@UAYBXDG4U> <@UCY83QS6Q>

was playing around with project theme and just hit this issue. Are the React modules for Elevate published anywhere? I saw a repo in HS github, but it was empty. <https://github.com/HubSpot/cms-elevate-theme-public> the only option I found to fix it was to delete all the templates and sections besides blank.hubl.html
<@UCTAN7RPA> I was told they were working on it but don't have any updates yet. <@UQWGKUEN7>
